Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2014 03:53PM lannear wrote: Hi.  I was interested to read your story.  Many women post starting antidepressants after their diagnosis.  I have been on antidepressant medication for many years now.  Stopping medication is not an option-mental health more important to me.  Unfortunately, I had to stop my medications-Prozac and Wellbrutin which worked really well due to decreasing effectiveness of Tamoxifen up to 50%.   I switched to Effexor-supposed to help with hotflashes-saw my GP yesterday who said Effexor could be causing more hotflashes, mood swings and sleep problems.  Scared to switch to another antidepressant at this point-I am struggling-Do you still take Citalopram??  This was suggested to me. If anyone has any advice, suggestions-that would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: "as-needed" happy pill? kebab Loveforlife

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2014 02:32PM lannear wrote: Interesting !! I am taking Effexor which I am tolerating well-hoping it is not making hotflashes worse-for now, I will keep taking it.  Thanks again, take care, Lori
Posts.Title: "as-needed" happy pill? kebab Loveforlife

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2014 07:19AM lannear wrote: I appreciate your help.  At this point, I hate to change antidepressants for a little while.  Very frustrating as I felt strong and positive a few months ago-seemed to be coping really well.  I was supposed to return to work end of the month but I am in no shape physically/emotionally.  One positive thing through this experience is that I am thinking about myself instead of worrying about effect of others at work.
Posts.Title: "as-needed" happy pill? kebab Loveforlife
